author: Kate O'Flaherty
title: Delete X—Millions Of Users Just Got A New Reason To Quit Today
text:
People are quitting X , formerly Twitter, in droves, citing toxic rhetoric and the platform’s new terms of service as reasons for deleting the social media platform.
One major reason to delete X that’s bad for your privacy is the Elon Musk-owned platform’s new terms of service , effective from today (Nov. 15). These state that all users must agree to let their posts be trained by artificial intelligence, including its own service Grok. It was previously possible to opt out from this.
The Elon Musk-owned site’s toxic content is another reason for leaving. On the day after the election, Nov. 6, X experienced its largest user exodus since the tech billionaire bought the platform in 2022, NBC News reported.
As the new terms of service become effective, why are people leaving X, what are the alternatives — and should you delete Elon Musk’s site too?
Forbes iOS 18.1—Apple Secretly Added A Cool New iPhone Security Feature By Kate O'Flaherty Who Has Deleted X (Twitter) Already—And Why? American retailers Best Buy and Target as well as US public broadcaster NPR are big names to quit the social media platform. Meanwhile big brands including Disney, Apple and IBM have paused their ads on X after they were found running alongside extremist content.
What Time Is Netflix’s Live Jake Paul Vs. Mike Tyson Fight On Friday? Trump’s Cabinet: Here Are His Picks For Key Roles—RFK Jr, Doug Burgum, Matt Gaetz And More NYT ‘Strands’ Today: Hints, Spangram And Answers For Friday, November 15th In November, former CNN anchor Don Lemon said he was quitting X due to an alarming change to X’s terms of service. He cited an issue arising from the changes, effective from Nov. 15, saying that disputes that arise between users and X as a company will be governed by “the laws of the State of Texas.”
According to The Washington Post, the decision to change the terms of service on X is an attempt to ensure that such lawsuits will be heard in courthouses that are a “hub for conservatives.”
This could protect Elon Musk from litigation, reports say.
UK newspaper The Guardian has also announced it will no longer post content on X, citing “often disturbing content” posted on the site.
“We wanted to let readers know that we will no longer post on any official Guardian editorial accounts on the social media site X,” the Guardian said.
Meanwhile, Spanish newspaper La Vanguardia announced it will stop posting on X saying the social media network had become an "echo chamber" for disinformation and conspiracy theories, according to Reuters .
Many people are concerned about the role of Elon Musk, who will be heading up incoming President Donald Trump's new Department of Government Efficiency. “If Elon Musk were to step into a government role, his influence could further politicise X, amplifying division and undermining its neutrality,” says Sam Budd, CEO and founder, Buddy Media.
The appeal of “separating oneself from Musk combined with looking for more left-leaning and liberal social platforms,” is one contributing factor leading people to delete X, says Laura Franklin-Hollier, digital account director at MikeWorldWide London.
“Add into a mix the general distrust users have towards their information being utilised for AI training, X has an incredibly uphill climb ahead if it manages to shake its perceived persona of harbouring hate-speech and rapidly spreading misinformation.”
I contacted X for a comment and will update this article if the social media site responds.
X (Twitter) Alternatives Leaving X is all well and good, especially if you care about privacy. But what other options do you have?
Threads has user numbers, but it’s owned by Meta and Mark Zuckerberg, so privacy conscious users will probably want to steer clear.
Blue Sky is another valid alternative. The up and coming site claimed it had added 1 million users in the past week, boosting its user base to over 15 million people. But despite rapidly increasing numbers, it doesn’t have the 600 million-strong user base of X.
Bluesky, developed by Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey, “aims to become a new and improved version of the Twitter we knew and loved,” says Chelsea Hopkins, social media and PR Manager at Fasthosts. “While it’s still early days for the app, it has grown exponentially over the past year as more people have looked for a viable alternative to X — and it receives a constant stream of updates and new features that are helping to solidify it as the go-to.”
Mastodon is also an option, but again, it needs time to build up user numbers.
Reasons To Delete X (Twitter) There are many reasons to delete X. The main risks of staying on X mostly relate to the content you may see and who can interact with you, says Hopkins. “The removal of the block feature was an extremely controversial decision that has left many feeling unsafe. Even if the accounts are restricted and can’t interact with your profile, they can still see your posts.”
“Disinformation is being created and spread faster than ever, a lack of moderation has caused a huge perceived rise in hateful language and content, and replies are filled with AI bots that make it difficult to have any real interaction — making X an extremely negative platform to be active on.”
Many people agree with this, so you’re not alone if you’re considering deleting X. If you are not so sure and want to try life without X but aren’t quite ready to delete it, you can deactivate your account by following these steps . If you delete your account , you have 30 days before X gets rid of it completely. Whatever you decide, it’s a good reason to get the process started now.

author: Emanuele Bianchi
title: Cambio di residenza all’estero, cosa fare?
text:
Trasferirsi all’estero è un’esperienza entusiasmante, ma può anche essere un processo complesso, soprattutto dal punto di vista burocratico.
Per aiutarti a navigare tra le pratiche e gli adempimenti necessari, ecco una guida completa sul cambio di residenza all’estero.
LEGGI ANCHE:
I residenti all’estero devono pagare l’IMU? Ecco come funziona
Iscrizione all’AIRE: un obbligo per chi si trasferisce
L’Anagrafe degli Italiani Residenti all’Estero (AIRE) è il registro che raccoglie i dati dei cittadini italiani residenti all’estero.
L’iscrizione all’AIRE è obbligatoria per chi si trasferisce all’estero per un periodo superiore ai 12 mesi. La richiesta di iscrizione va presentata entro 90 giorni dall’arrivo nel nuovo paese, presso il Consolato italiano competente per territorio.
Documenti necessari per il trasferimento
I documenti richiesti per il trasferimento all’estero variano a seconda del Paese di destinazione.
In generale, è necessario avere un passaporto valido, un visto (se richiesto), un codice fiscale italiano e eventuali documenti specifici richiesti dal Paese ospitante (ad esempio, certificati di nascita, matrimonio, titoli di studio).
Assistenza sanitaria all’estero
Se ti iscrivi all’AIRE, non perderai il diritto all’assistenza sanitaria in Italia. Tuttavia, è importante informarsi sulle modalità di accesso all’assistenza sanitaria nel paese di destinazione, che potrebbero variare a seconda degli accordi bilaterali tra Italia e il paese ospitante.
LEGGI ANCHE:
 I residenti all’estero devono pagare la TASI? Ecco come funziona
Questioni fiscali e tributarie
Il trasferimento all’estero può avere implicazioni fiscali e tributarie. È importante informarsi sulla normativa fiscale del Paese di destinazione e verificare se sussiste l’obbligo di dichiarare i redditi in Italia.
Inoltre, l’iscrizione all’AIRE non comporta automaticamente la perdita dei benefici fiscali sulla prima casa in Italia.
Vantaggi dell’iscrizione all’AIRE
Oltre ad essere un obbligo di legge, l’iscrizione all’AIRE offre numerosi vantaggi, tra cui:
- Ricevere assistenza consolare: il Consolato italiano ti fornirà supporto in caso di necessità (ad esempio, smarrimento documenti, assistenza legale, rimpatrio);
- Partecipare alle elezioni politiche: potrai votare per corrispondenza alle elezioni politiche italiane;
- Accedere ai servizi consolari: potrai richiedere certificati, documenti e informazioni presso il Consolato italiano.
Rientro in Italia: cosa fare?
Se decidi di tornare a vivere in Italia, dovrai comunicare il tuo rimpatrio al Comune italiano entro 90 giorni dall’arrivo. La mancata comunicazione può comportare sanzioni amministrative.
Patente di guida all’estero
La patente di guida italiana è valida nella maggior parte dei Paesi esteri. Tuttavia, in alcuni casi potrebbe essere necessario convertirla in una patente locale.
Informati presso le autorità competenti del Paese di destinazione.
Scuole italiane all’estero e riconoscimento titoli di studio
Se ti trasferisci con la tua famiglia, potresti voler sapere se ci sono scuole italiane nel paese di destinazione.
Il Ministero degli Affari Esteri e della Cooperazione Internazionale (MAECI) mette a disposizione un elenco delle scuole italiane all’estero. Inoltre, se hai conseguito un titolo di studio all’estero, puoi richiederne il riconoscimento in Italia.
Aziende italiane all’estero
Se cerchi lavoro all’estero, potresti voler conoscere le aziende italiane che operano nel Paese di destinazione. Il Ministero degli Affari Esteri e della Cooperazione Internazionale (MAECI) pubblica un elenco delle aziende italiane all’estero.
Informazioni e assistenza
Per ulteriori informazioni e assistenza sul cambio di residenza all’estero, puoi rivolgerti al Consolato italiano competente per territorio o consultare il sito web del Ministero degli Affari Esteri e della Cooperazione Internazionale.

author: Дмитрий Ульянов
title: В Германии предупредили о серьезных последствиях для экономики при отказе от российского газа - МК
text:
Экономика Германии будет уничтожена, если в Евросоюзе решат навсегда отказаться от импорта газа из РФ. Такое предупреждение сделал глава Немецкого совета за конституцию и суверенитет Ральф Нимайер.
"В случае полного запрета ЕС на импорт российского газа нашей экономике настанет конец. Мы потеряли бы много рабочих мест и отраслей промышленности, особенно среди малых и средних предприятий, которые не могут закупать газ в Катаре и США", - сказал Нимайер агентству РИА Новости на полях ПМЭФ-2025.
Он отметил, что в таком случае газ для малых и средних предприятий Германии окажется слишком дорогим. В связи с этим им придется закрыться.
В то же время крупные предприятия, скорее всего, смогут найти выход из такой ситуации. Однако Нимайер подчеркнул, что большинство компаний в Германии как раз таки и являются небольшими.
Недавно стало известно, что еврокомиссар по энергетике Дан Йоргенсен представил предложения Еврокомиссии по полному отказа от российского топлива к концу 2027 года. При этом новые контракты на поставку запретят заключать уже с конца 2025 года.
Ранее в Германии возмутились поведением канцлера ФРГ Фридриха Мерца на саммите G7.
